conflicts.name: ~libtraceevent
conflicts.description: linux-perf: linux 6.2 removed internal libtraceevent, and it's highly recommended

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: babeltrace
variants.description: libbabeltrace support for CTF data format

variants.name: libaudit
variants.description: get perf-trace syscall table from libaudit at runtime, rather than unistd.h at buildtime

variants.name: zstd
variants.description: Zstandard based runtime trace compression in record mode

variants.name: openssl
variants.description: support generating build-ids for ELFs generated by jitdump

dependencies.name: asciidoc
dependencies.description:
A presentable text document format for writing articles, UNIX man pages
and other small to medium sized documents.

dependencies.name: audit-userspace
dependencies.description: Linux audit userspace

dependencies.name: babeltrace
dependencies.description:
Babeltrace is a trace viewer and converter reading and writing the
Common Trace Format (CTF). Its main use is to pretty-print CTF traces
into a human-readable text output ordered by time.

dependencies.name: binutils
dependencies.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: capstone
dependencies.description:
Capstone is a lightweight multi-platform, multi-architecture disassembly
framework.

dependencies.name: elfutils
dependencies.description:
elfutils is a collection of various binary tools such as eu-objdump, eu-
readelf, and other utilities that allow you to inspect and manipulate
ELF files. Refer to Table 5.Tools Included in elfutils for Red Hat
Developer for a complete list of binary tools that are distributed with
the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of elfutils.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: java
dependencies.description: The free and opensource java implementation

dependencies.name: libcap
dependencies.description:
Libcap implements the user-space interfaces to the POSIX 1003.1e
capabilities available in Linux kernels. These capabilities are a
partitioning of the all powerful root privilege into a set of distinct
privileges.

dependencies.name: libiberty
dependencies.description:
The libiberty.a library from GNU binutils. Libiberty provides demangling
and support functions for the GNU toolchain.

dependencies.name: libpfm4
dependencies.description:
libpfm4 is a userspace library to help setup performance events for use
with the perf_events Linux kernel interface.

dependencies.name: libtraceevent
dependencies.description: Library to parse raw trace event formats.

dependencies.name: libunwind
dependencies.description:
A portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the
call-chain of a program.

dependencies.name: numactl
dependencies.description: NUMA support for Linux

dependencies.name: openssl
dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: slang
dependencies.description: An interpreted language and programing library.

dependencies.name: xmlto
dependencies.description:
Utility xmlto is a simple shell script for converting XML files to
various formats. It serves as easy to use command line frontend to make
fine output without remembering many long options and searching for the
syntax of the backends.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.
